page.title: 07ANCILLARY UNITS (b)
page.content: {The Douglas Macmillan Ward,}situated on the ground floor of the King Edward VII Hospital, caters solely for the terminally ill. At the moment there are 9 beds available, though this number will be extended to 22 later this year. The beds are paid for by the{National Society for Cancer {Relief.} Home Care Sisters operate from this ward, caring for the patients in their homes and also giving support to their families. Patients are finally admitted to the ward when Home Care is no longer viable. Since patients in the Macmillan Ward know they have come there to die one would probably imagine it to be a most depressing place, but, on the contrary, the atmosphere is very happy and much warmth and love are generated.
